description:
The Carrier team focuses on Google-branded hardware across product categories. Our team is responsible for managing partnerships with our top carriers, including developing channel strategy, negotiating commercial terms, marketing and merchandising, and overall market share goals. We partner cross-functionally with marketing, product & engineering, finance and retail marketing teams internally, and with our carrier counterparts across these disciplines.

As the Strategic Partner Manager, you will develop regional relationships within a US Carrier and will lead Google’s product success, focused on driving volume share for Pixel and all other Google branded hardware. You will manage product launches, promotional planning, sell-out tracking and collaborative forecasting. In addition, you will be part of a broader Carrier team, focused on all aspects of our mobile business, including retail merchandising, training relationship management, and solving problems at a local level. Through partnering cross-functionally with the Marketing, Finance, Retail Operations and Product teams, you will drive a successful business plan that helps us reach our goals.

The Hardware Partnerships team was formed with the purpose of bringing the best of Google’s software and hardware to our users by bringing to market and distributing a Google-branded hardware portfolio. The team is responsible for managing all partnerships with carriers, retailers and resellers worldwide. This includes the partnerships for products such as Pixel, Daydream View, Google Wifi, Google Nest Thermostat, Chromecast Ultra and Google Home.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of relevant experience with or telecommunication device, consumer electronics or similar manufacturer in sales, account management, channel management, marketing, retail operations, or retail management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 2 years of industry experience in the mobile devices space specialized in the carrier channel.
  • Experience with mobile devices and services in business development or sales in a fast-paced industry.
  • Experience in hands-on relationship management with a proven track record in reaching and exceeding goals with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
  • Experience with planning and managing at both the strategic and operational level within a carrier sales environment with repeated financial and expansion success.
  • Demonstrated strategic and analytical sales approach with a focus on establishing presence and building relationships with clients within the telecom sector.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills; ability to manage ambiguity, solve complex problems and scale effectively across a large organization.
responsibilities:
• Lead the introduction and management of Google’s hardware products, business planning, target setting, forecasting, and budget allocations.
  • Develop compelling and engaging promotional plans, leveraging the collective marketing assets made available by Google and a US Carrier.
  • Work cross functionally to ensure that Google remains top of mind for the assigned US Carrier regional, retail and marketing leadership, and especially with consumers and associates alike.
  • Serve as the primary internal and external interface from a sales and day-to-day account management perspective.
title: Strategic Partner Manager, US Carrier Hardware Partnerships
